result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee A Allen

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lee A Allen not in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Lee A Allen.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Case set for sentencing hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court orders bail forfeited.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Lee A Allen in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Lee A Allen.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered. Court vacates jury trial. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

Defendant Lee A Allen in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Lee A Allen.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial. State's offer has been conveyed to defense and rejected by the defendant. State anticipates a request for adjournment of the jury trial. Defense requests an adjourned final pretrial. Court grants requests. Court reminds defendant that all bail conditions remain in full force and effect. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, filed.
State's Supplemental Witness List, filed.

Defendant Lee A Allen in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Case set for final pretrial and Jury Trial. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Lee A Allen in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case recalled. Defendant appears in court. Court vacated warrant and reinstated bail. Court admonished defendant for untimely appearance. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling Conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court orders bench warrant to issue for the defendant.  The Court ordered that the defendant is to be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of  PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 9 pages) commencing 5-19-22 by Amy De La Rosa.

Defendant Lee A Allen in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Kamps. Court took judical notice to 19CF5185.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and filed
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lee A Allen in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lee A Allen in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lee A Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
